```{r}
# Import

```

```{r}
# Score surveys
# Exposure
exposure = data %>% select(record_id,redcap_event_name,stay_at_home.factor:died.factor)
data$exposure_sum = apply(exposure[,3:ncol(exposure)],1,function(r){
  length(which(r == "Yes"))
})
# Impact
impact = data %>% select(record_id,redcap_event_name,parenting:mood)
# Convert 5 to NA
impact[,3:ncol(impact)] = lapply(impact[,3:ncol(impact)],function(c){
  c[c==5]=NA
  c
})
# Mean of all items - NA if more than 3 are missing
data$impact_mean = apply(impact[,3:ncol(impact)],1,function(r){
  if(sum(is.na(r))>3){NA}else{
    mean(as.numeric(r),na.rm = T)
  }
})
# Distress
distress = data %>% select(record_id,redcap_event_name,distress:child_distress)
data$family_distress = apply(distress[,3:ncol(distress)],1,mean,na.rm = T)
data$family_distress[is.nan(data$family_distress)] = NA

# Clean up
rm(distress,exposure,impact,exclude)
```

# Table 1

```{r results='asis'}
# Get demographic information - per Erin "The child demographic information is under the child IDs (so all of the 2000 IDs, since the 1000 IDs are all of the parents)"
# Convert age to years
demographics = data %>% 
  filter(grepl("baseline",redcap_event_name),as.numeric(substr(record_id,1,4))>=2000) %>%
  mutate(age = as.numeric(child_age) / 365.25,
         t1d_duration = as.numeric(t1d_duration) / 365.25)
# Table 1 
t1_form = as.formula(" ~ age + t1d_duration + gender.factor + child_insurance.factor + race.factor")
newlabels = list(age = "Age (Years)",t1d_duration = "T1D Duration",race.factor = "Race",
                 gender.factor = "Gender", child_insurance.factor = "Insurance")
t1 = tableby(t1_form,demographics)
summary(t1,labelTranslations = newlabels)
```

# CEFIS Scores

```{r}
# Filter out unnecessary rows and rename time points ("arm" refers to child's age)
scores = data %>% 
  filter(as.numeric(substr(record_id,1,4))<2000,
         grepl("baseline",redcap_event_name) | grepl("3_month",redcap_event_name)) %>%
  mutate(Timepoint = sub("_arm_.*","",redcap_event_name))
t = scores %>% pivot_wider(id_cols = record_id,names_from = Timepoint,
                           values_from = c(exposure_sum,impact_mean,distress,
                                           child_distress,family_distress))
scores$Timepoint = factor(scores$Timepoint,levels = c("baseline","3_month"),
                          labels = c("Baseline","3 Month"))
# Compare scores
comp = scores %>% group_by(Timepoint) %>% 
  summarise("Exposure" = mean(exposure_sum,na.rm = T),
            "Exposure N" = sum(!is.na(exposure_sum)),
            "Exposure P" = NA,
            "Impact" = mean(impact_mean,na.rm = T),
            "Impact N" = sum(!is.na(impact_mean)),
            "Impact P" = NA,
            "Distress" = mean(distress,na.rm = T),
            "Distress N" = sum(!is.na(distress)),
            "Distress P" = NA,
            "Child Distress" = mean(child_distress,na.rm = T),
            "Child Distress N" = sum(!is.na(child_distress)),
            "Child Distress P" = NA,
            "Family Distress" = mean(family_distress,na.rm = T),
            "Family Distress N" = sum(!is.na(family_distress)),
            "Family Distress P" = NA)
comp$`Exposure P` = t.test(t$exposure_sum_baseline,t$exposure_sum_3_month,paired = T)$p.value
comp$`Impact P` = t.test(t$impact_mean_baseline,t$impact_mean_3_month,paired = T)$p.value
comp$`Distress P` = t.test(t$distress_baseline,t$distress_3_month,paired = T)$p.value
comp$`Child Distress P` = t.test(t$child_distress_baseline,t$child_distress_3_month,paired = T)$p.value
comp$`Family Distress P` = t.test(t$family_distress_baseline,t$family_distress_3_month,
                                  paired = T)$p.value
# Format and print
comp = t(comp)
colnames(comp) = comp["Timepoint",]
comp = comp[-which(rownames(comp)=="Timepoint"),] 
kable(comp)
```

P values are for the change in score from baseline to 3-month visit.
